thread.title: Pottstown Hospital nurses ratify new 3-year contract
thread.title_full: Pottstown Hospital nurses ratify new 3-year contract

author: PASNAP
title: Pottstown Hospital nurses ratify new 3-year contract
text:
POTTSTOWN, Pa. - Nearly 300 registered nurses at Pottstown Hospital have ratified a new three-year contract following more than nine months of negotiations.
Pottstown hospital nurses rally for better contract
The vote, held on August 6, resulted in 96% of nurses voting in favor of the agreement.
The nurses, represented by Pottstown Nurses United, had scheduled the day for either a strike authorization vote or contract ratification.
Officials say the ratified contract focuses on improving nurse recruitment and retention, with the goal of strengthening patient care.
“We worked hard for a fair contract that respects the work we do, and allows us to care safely for our patients,” said Domin. “We believe we accomplished that goal. We stuck together for what we believe in, and I think that made the difference. We see this as a win for us, for our patients, and for our hospital.”
The agreement follows a prolonged bargaining process and applies to the hospital’s nursing staff, including those working in medical-surgical units and other frontline roles.
